question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: decimal()] [Decimal Consistency] If two tokens have different decimals (e.g., 6 and 18), can vault calculations mixing these prices cause magnitude errors? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: register_token_price()] [Decimal Immutability] Once registered, price.decimal cannot be changed, but if a token's economics change requiring decimal adjustment, is there a migration path? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: register_token_price()] [Max Price Value] Can token_price be set to u256::MAX (2^256 - 1), and would this cause overflow in vault valuation calculations that multiply price * balance? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: update_token_price()] [Price Volatility] Can feeder update prices with extreme volatility (e.g., 10x increase) in a single update without any validation, enabling oracle manipulation attacks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: update_price()] [Price Discontinuity] Can friend modules cause price discontinuities by updating prices that differ by orders of magnitude from the previous value without sanity checks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: get_token_price()] [Price Zero Semantic] When price.value = 0, the validity flag is false, but can this be misinterpreted as

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: register_token_price()] [Genesis Timestamp] Can prices be registered with timestamp = 0 if clock is not properly initialized, causing all staleness checks to fail? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: get_token_price()] [Clock Regression] If Sui network experiences clock regression (time goes backwards), can current_ts < price.timestamp cause staleness check to fail for fresh prices? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: update_token_price()] [Timestamp Injection] Can feeder call update_token_price() with a Clock object from a different context to manipulate perceived update time? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: get_token_price()] [Epoch Boundary] Can staleness checks behave incorrectly at epoch boundaries when timestamps wrap or reset? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: register_token_price()] [Oracle ID 0] Can oracle_id = 0 be registered, and could this conflict with uninitialized or default values in consuming contracts? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: register_token_price()] [Oracle ID 255] Can oracle_id = 255 be registered without issues, or does this edge case cause problems in contracts using u8::MAX as a sentinel value? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: update_token_price_batch()] [Oracle ID Sequence] Can batch updates assume oracle_ids are sequential (0,1,2...), causing failures if IDs are registered in arbitrary order? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Table Storage] [Oracle ID Reuse] If a price could be removed (hypothetically), can the same oracle_id be reused for a different token, confusing historical data consumers? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Struct: OracleAdminCap] [Single Admin Risk] Only one OracleAdminCap is created in init(), creating a single point of failure if the admin key is compromised? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: create_feeder()] [Feeder Revocation] No mechanism exists to revoke OracleFeederCap, can compromised feeders maintain update privileges indefinitely? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Struct: OracleFeederCap] [Cap Counting] No tracking of how many OracleFeederCaps exist, can this lead to authorization sprawl and security audit difficulties? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: init()] [Cap Distribution] Both caps are transferred to tx_context::sender(), can this be exploited if init() is called by a contract rather than an EOA? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: price_object()] [Public Read Access] price_object() is public but doesn't check version, can this be used to read prices from incompatible oracle versions? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: safe_decimal()] [Redundant Function] safe_decimal() duplicates decimal() logic but takes immutable reference, suggesting intended safety difference not implemented? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: get_token_price()] [Public Staleness Logic] Staleness validation is in public function, can malicious contracts wrap this with modified staleness acceptance logic? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: version_migrate()] [Entry Function Trap] entry fun version_migrate() always aborts, could this cause user funds loss if called accidentally with gas paid? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: oracle_version_migrate()] [Migration State] During migration, oracle.version is updated but price data remains unchanged, can this cause interpretation errors? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: version_verification()] [Verification Timing] version_verification() is called at function start, but can oracle.version change mid-execution via friend module? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/protocol/oracle/sources/oracle.move] [Function: oracle_version_migrate()] [No Downtime] Migration happens without pausing, can active price reads occur during version update causing inconsistency? (Medium)
